questions.question: In “The Censors,” how does Juan get his first promotion after taking the job as a censor?

choices.answer: by betraying a fellow worker
by replacing an accident victim
by seeking his letter to Mariana
by offering to do dangerous work

questions.question: Which statement best sums up Juan’s career in “The Censors”?

choices.answer: He remains at the same level and never gets promoted.
He begins at a low level and then keeps getting promoted.
He is promoted to a high level but then keeps getting demoted.
He is promoted to a middle level but then keeps getting demoted.

questions.question: What happens to Juan at the end of “The Censors”?

choices.answer: He finally discovers his letter to Mariana and is able to destroy it.
He becomes so devoted to his job that he stops eating and gets sick.
He reaches Section B, has too few letters to censor, and grows bored.
He censors his own letter, getting himself in trouble, and is executed.

questions.question: Which description best illustrates what it means to sabotage something?

choices.answer: A spy removes a vital part of a car so that it no longer starts.
A police officer gives a driver a ticket for driving a car too fast.
A motorist registers a car with the Department of Motor Vehicles.
A driver visits a service station and fills a car’s tank with gasoline

questions.question: How would someone most likely intercept a message being delivered?

choices.answer: prepare the message well in advance
suggest ways to speed up delivery time
read the message before it is delivered
pass the message along via email or text

questions.question: What sort of person can best be described as subversive?

choices.answer: someone who is mourning a loss
someone who is plotting a rebellion
someone who has learned a new skill
someone who has inherited a huge fortune

questions.question: What main reason for Juan’s applying for a job as a censor does this comment support?

choices.answer: Juan wishes to show support for his government.
Juan wants to prevent a friend from getting in trouble.
Juan seeks a well-paid job with good opportunities for advancement.
Juan hopes to snoop into the private lives of friends and neighbors.

questions.question: Which of these sentences from “The Censors” best supports the answer to Part A?(8)

choices.answer: He knows that they examine, sniff, feel, and read between the lines
Ulterior motives couldn’t be overlooked in the Censorship Division
in  Section F, where letters are carefully checked for poison dust
Very few letters reached him in Section B so he read them over and over

questions.question: What do the details in “The Censors” suggest about the work of censoring letters?

choices.answer: Few letters are actually scrutinized.
The censors tend to be fairly lenient.
A letter can be censored for a variety of reasons.
The censors follow a set of unclear guidelines.

questions.question: “The Censors,” what main change has Juan experienced by the time he reaches Section B in the Censorship Division?

choices.answer: He comes to despise his job as a censor.
He becomes proud of his job as a censor.
He wins great fame in his job as a censor.
He grows quite lazy in his job as a censor.

questions.question: Which of these sentences from “The Censors” best supports the answer to Part A? (10)

choices.answer: The building had a festive air on the outsidecontrasted with its inner
He didn’t even worry when, in his first month, he was sent to Section K
He had a truly patriotic task, both self-denying and uplifting.
He was  to congratulate himself for having  discovered his true mission

questions.question: Who or what is the main target of satire in “The Censors”?

choices.answer: the repressive practices of dictatorships
the boring, repetitious nature of many jobs
government workers who do not do their jobs properly
friends and coworkers who are disloyal to one another

questions.question: Which of the following quotations from “The Censors” best illustrates the story’s humorous, mocking tone?

choices.answer: Without thinking, he sat down at his table and wrote her a letter
But he knows that the Censor’s Secret Command operates all over the world
That’s how Juan managed to join the Post Office’s Censorship Division
By working hard, he reached Section E where the job became more interesting

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Latin prefix sub-?

choices.answer: in back of; behind
strange; foreign
opposite; different
under; below

questions.question: The Latin root -terr- means “earth.indicate where you would most likely find a subterranean hideout.

choices.answer: on the roof
in the ground
near a foreign land
in front of mountain

questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains an example of hyperbole?

choices.answer: The crickets’ chirping often makes it very difficult for me to fall asleep.
I sleep better in the city because I’m not used to the sound of crickets.
The crickets’ racket is louder than any noise in the world.
I sleep better in the city, but I am a poor sleeper in general.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains an example of understatement?

choices.answer: I only ate one packet of crackers today, so I’m starving.
Our sunburned shoulders prove how hot the sun really is.
Her voice is the most beautiful sound in the entire universe.
The sharks surrounding our life raft pose a bit of a problem.

questions.question: In which of the following sentences is a humorous tone achieved through understatement?

choices.answer: Those fancy shoes must be killing your feet!
His shoes are bigger than cruise ships.
“I’m a little uncomfortable,” she said after walking two miles in heels.
These running shoes are as light as a feather and as soft as a pillow.

questions.question: Nothing to stop them from going to hidden Paris, kidnapping Mariana, and returning to homes,fulfilling the noble mission

choices.answer: nothing
hidden
fulfilled
noble
